page.title: 19THE "TWINNING" OF GORING
page.content: The principle of{twinning}is to help promote friendship and understanding between different countries. For these reasons Goring Parish Council decided in 1977-78 to "twin" with a French town and applied to the British Council for a suitable twin town. Of those offered,{Belleme}in Normandy was chosen because it is of a comparable size to Goring, is also in an agricultural area and is relatively near the Channel which facilitates visits. In 1979 there were official ceremonies in both towns to celebrate the twinning of Goring and Belleme. Membership of the{Goring-on- {Thames Twinning Association,}which is run by an elected Management Committee, is open free to the entire population of Goring and area around.
